issue.title: How to scrape PDF from CNKI
issue.body: # Troubleshooting ## Describe your environment * Operating system: mac * Python version: 3.7 * Hardware: macbook * Internet access: * Jupyter notebook or not? [Y/N]: Y * Which chapter of book?: chapter 6 ## Describe your question I want to scrape the whole PDF text from people's daily in CNKI but have no idea how to do it. Do I need to download all the articles? * Website: (one article) http://kns.cnki.net/kcms/detail/detail.aspx?dbcode=CCND&filename=RMRB200801010026&dbname=CCND2008&uid=WEEvREcwSlJHSldRa1FhdXNXa0d1YXREREQva29YUjBMb0hPUG15bXpFaz0=$9A4hF_YAuvQ5obgVAqNKPCYcEjKensW4IQMovwHtwkF4VYPoHbKxJw!! * CNKI: http://navi.cnki.net/KNavi/NPaperDetail?pcode=CCND&bzpym=RMRB ## Describe the efforts you have spent on this issue I found this website about pdf scraping https://medium.com/@rqaiserr/how-to-convert-pdfs-into-searchable-key-words-with-python-85aab86c544f

comment.body: But there is an error called Multiple definitions in dictionary at byte 0x7eb1 for key /MediaBox

issue.title: How to loop in different format {}
issue.body: # Troubleshooting ## Describe your environment * Operating system: mac * Python version: 3.7 * Hardware: macbook * Internet access: http://paper.people.com.cn/rmrb/html/2008-10/27/nbs.D110000renmrb_01.htm * Jupyter notebook or not? [Y/N]: Y * Which chapter of book?: ## Describe your question I am scraping articles from people's daily I want to 1. find different articles, 2. turn pages (4 pages) 3. change the dates at the same time. But how can I do it with .format() if the number for each purposes is different. And one of them is not a fixed number, since there might be 4/5/6/7 articles articles) . ## The minimum code (snippet) to reproduce the issue Example: ```python def gettext(url): import requests r=requests.get(url) r.encoding = 'utf-8' import bs4 mypage = bs4.BeautifulSoup(r.text) text = mypage.find(attrs={'class': 'text_c'}).text.strip() return text for i in range (1,9): url = "http://paper.people.com.cn/rmrb/html/2008-10/27/nw.D110000renmrb_20081027_{}-01.htm".format(i) onepage = gettext(url) print(onepage) ```

issue.title: How to loop in different format {}
issue.body: # Troubleshooting ## Describe your environment * Operating system: mac * Python version: 3.7 * Hardware: macbook * Internet access: http://paper.people.com.cn/rmrb/html/2008-10/27/nbs.D110000renmrb_01.htm * Jupyter notebook or not? [Y/N]: Y * Which chapter of book?: ## Describe your question I am scraping articles from people's daily I want to 1. find different articles, 2. turn pages (4 pages) 3. change the dates at the same time. But how can I do it with .format() if the number for each purposes is different. And one of them is not a fixed number, since there might be 4/5/6/7 articles articles) . ## The minimum code (snippet) to reproduce the issue Example: ```python def gettext(url): import requests r=requests.get(url) r.encoding = 'utf-8' import bs4 mypage = bs4.BeautifulSoup(r.text) text = mypage.find(attrs={'class': 'text_c'}).text.strip() return text for i in range (1,9): url = "http://paper.people.com.cn/rmrb/html/2008-10/27/nw.D110000renmrb_20081027_{}-01.htm".format(i) onepage = gettext(url) print(onepage) ```

comment.body: It seemed that I successfully turned pages and dates, but it kept raising errors. I know it is because the number of articles differs from every page. How can I solve it? Also, I am supposed to start from the first date of October, but I don't know how to start from 01 to 31. ```python def gettext(url): import requests r=requests.get(url) r.encoding = 'utf-8' import bs4 mypage = bs4.BeautifulSoup(r.text) text = mypage.find(attrs={'class': 'text_c'}).text.strip() return text c = 10 while c < 32: a = 1 while a < 7: for b in range(1,5): url = "http://paper.people.com.cn/rmrb/html/2008-10/{2}/nw.D110000renmrb_200810{2}_{0}-0{1}.htm".format(a,b,c) onepage = gettext(url) print(onepage) a = a + 1 c = c + 1 ```

But how can I do it with .format() if the number for each purposes is different. And one of them is not a fixed number, since there might be 4/5/6/7 articles articles) . ## The minimum code (snippet) to reproduce the issue Example: ```python def gettext(url): import requests r=requests.get(url) r.encoding = 'utf-8' import bs4 mypage = bs4.BeautifulSoup(r.text) text = mypage.find(attrs={'class': 'text_c'}).text.strip() return text for i in range (1,9): url = "http://paper.people.com.cn/rmrb/html/2008-10/27/nw.D110000renmrb_20081027_{}-01.htm".format(i) onepage = gettext(url) print(onepage) ```

issue.title: dealing with splitted names
issue.body: when I split the data into strings. The first names and last names are being splited as well. How can I #combine them into one complete name#?

comment.body:
```python
data=[]
for i in allplayers:
    name=i.find(attrs={'class': 'fi-p__name'})
    g=i.find_all(attrs={'class': 'fi-table__td'})
    data.append((name.text.strip(),
                 g[0].text,
                 g[1].text,
                 g[2].text,
                 g[3].text,
                 g[6].text,
                 g[7].text)
    )
```
I solved the problem by appending strings in the first place! 
In this way, there is no need to split [data] in to strings anymore. 
@hupili @ChicoXYC  Thank you~~ :)

issue.title: dealing with splitted names
issue.body: when I split the data into strings. The first names and last names are being splited as well. How can I #combine them into one complete name#?

comment.body:
import requests
r=requests.get('https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/statistics/players/goal-scored')
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup
import bs4
mypage = bs4.BeautifulSoup(r.text)
allplayer=mypage.find('tbody')
allplayers=allplayer.find_all('tr')
player1=allplayer.find('tr')
data=[]
for i in allplayers:
    name=i.find(attrs={'class': 'fi-p__name'}).text.strip()
    g=i.find_all(attrs={'class': 'fi-table__td'})
    goal=g[0].text
    ass=g[1].text
    mins=g[2].text
    maches=g[3].text
    left=g[6].text
    right=g[7].text
    data.append(name+'  '+goal+'  '+ass+'  '+mins+'  '+maches+'  '+left+'  '+right)
newinfo=[]
for i in data:
    newinfo.append(i.split())
newinfo
import csv
with open('fifa.csv','w')as f:
    mywriter=csv.writer(f)
    header=['name','goal','ass','mins','maches','left','right']
    mywriter.writerow(header)
    mywriter.writerows(newinfo)
f.close()

@ChicoXYC  thanks a lot
